definitions: To lift or haul (a heavy thing) with great effort.
To produce (a sigh, groan, etc.) with effort.
To be full of or crowded with people or things.
examples: He was heaving the anchor onto the deck.
She was heaving rocks into the river.
He was heaving a sigh of relief.
The patient was heaving all night.
The boat was heaving on the waves.
The club was heaving with people.
